I have an assessment no. in the records of Janakavaram Gram Panchayat in my name.
253, the house tax is issued as Rs. 7,85,000/- in letters seven lakhs and ninety-five thousand rupees, the immovable property as per the following schedule, having been duly settled to you free of charge, and the settled property is to be taken into your possession on this very day. Therefore, from now on, the property as per the following schedule shall be kept in your possession and you shall pay the Panchayat tax etc., and your sons and grandsons shall enjoy it freely and without any hindrance, with all the full rights of donation, exchange, sale and possession. Neither you, your heirs nor I, my heirs, can ever have any disputes or claims regarding this experience. I have assured you that no one has ever alienated the property as per the schedule and have settled it for you. Scheduled Property

boundaries.boundaryN: House Boundary of  Battula Koteswara Rao

sections.content:
The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No. 2323 of 2025, dated 03/Sep/2025, executed by Ulava Pati Lakshmi in favour of her Husband, Ulavapati Venu Babu, towards the property admeasuring an extent of 100 Sq. Yds., bearing house number 8-26, Assessment Number 253, comprised in survey number 534-1, situated in Panguluru Village, Janakavaram Gram Panchayath and J. Panguluru Mandal, within the District of Bapatla, registered at sub-registrar office Inkollu, is bounded as follows:

North by: House Boundary of  Battula Koteswara Rao
South by: Boundary of  Panchayath Bazar
East by: House Boundary of Chukkachinna Anjaneyulu 
West by: House Boundary of Ulavapati Venkateswarlu

As per Registered Documents: 1. The property in survey number 534-1, bearing house no. 8-26 and Assessment Number 253, situated in Panguluru, measuring about 100 Sq. Yds., was originally owned by Ulavapati Lakshmi, who acquired the property through from her Maternal House. [Ref:Deed] 2. The aforementioned Ulavapati Lakshmi executed a Gift Settlement Deed on 03/Sep/2025, registered as document No. 2323 of 2025, before the SRO Inkollu in favour of her Husband, Ulavapati Venu Babu towards the property measuring 100 Sq. Yds., bearing house no.8-26 and Assessment Number 253, comprised in survey no.534-1, situated at Panguluru. (B) Additional Documents Supporting the Title : The Property Tax Receipt No. 3840, dated 25/Aug/2025, imprinted by the Janakavaram Grama Panchayath Secretary discloses that Ulavapati Lakshmi has paid property tax towards Assessment number 253.

The property tax receipt attached discloses that Ulavapati Lakshmi is the taxpayer, hence, it is presumed that the mutation proceedings were not concluded in the name of the current owner  Ulavapati Venu Babu.

contentList: Document Name * Document Description * Document Date * Document Type

sections.content:
We have reviewed the documents provided to us as per the F.I policy and have concluded that the Ulavapati Venu Babu, possesses a clear, valid, and marketable title to the property admeasuring an extent of 100 Sq. Yds., bearing house number 8-26, Assessment Number 253, comprised in survey number 534-1, situated in Panguluru Village, Janakavaram Gram Panchayath and J. Panguluru Mandal, within the District of Bapatla, registered at sub-registrar office Inkollu.

Further, the current owner, Ulavapati Venu Babu is to be added as a party to the loan structure along with the applicant Ulavapati Lakshmi.

Note: It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number, and Split Survey/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible. Further, The EC has been verified and downloaded using the property address parameter, as the option to retrieve EC records using the document number is currently unavailable in the Online EC portal. Thereupon, It is observed that house number is mentioned in Deed where as in EC house number is not reflecting, therefore it is advisable for F.I. to update EC.
